text: working popular R optimizers stats::nlm() stats::optim(), can challenging compare results due inconsistencies function arguments output labels. instance, stats::nlm() uses f function argument p argument initial values, stats::optim() uses fn function argument par initial values. Additionally, optimal parameters function values labeled differently, estimate minimum used stats::nlm() par value stats::optim(). different , example, pracma::nelder_mead(). inconsistency frustrating, especially one wants apply compare different optimizers.

title: Unified Framework for Numerical Optimizers in R
text: standardize inputs outputs different R optimizers make easier apply compare, can define using define_optimizer() function apply using apply_optimizer(). way, inputs outputs always consistent format across different optimizers. demonstration, say want minimize Ackley function … … compare performance three optimizers: stats::nlm(), stats::optim(), pracma::nelder_mead(). Wrappers first two already available … … latter (optimizer like) can use general constructor: , .optimizer optimization algorithm, .objective name function input, .initial name starting parameter values input, .value name optimal function value output, .parameter name optimal parameter vector output, .direction indicates whether optimizer minimizes maximizes. Now optimize (initial parameter vector initial = c(-1, 1)): optimization output, value parameter consistently denote optimal function values optimal parameters, additional optimizer-specific outputs preserved. optimization time seconds, seconds, initial parameter vector, initial, added: way, surprised see value stats::optim() different two optimizers? Apparently, optimizer become trapped local minimum. interested exploring initialization problem numerical optimization, may find {ino} R package useful.
code: f_ackley <- function(x) {   stopifnot(is.numeric(x), length(x) == 2)   -20 * exp(-0.2 * sqrt(0.5 * (x[1]^2 + x[2]^2))) -     exp(0.5 * (cos(2 * pi * x[1]) + cos(2 * pi * x[2]))) + exp(1) + 20 } optimizer_nlm() #> <optimizer 'stats::nlm'> optimizer_optim() #> <optimizer 'stats::optim'> optimizer_nelder_mead <- define_optimizer(   .optimizer = pracma::nelder_mead,   .objective = "fn",   .initial = "x0",   .value = "fmin",   .parameter = "xmin",   .direction = "min" ) results <- lapply(   list(optimizer_nlm(), optimizer_optim(), optimizer_nelder_mead),   apply_optimizer,    objective = f_ackley,    initial = c(-1, 1) ) names(results) <- c("stats::nlm", "stats::optim", "pracma::nelder_mead") str(results) #> List of 3 #>  $ stats::nlm         :List of 7 #>   ..$ value     : num 1.66e-06 #>   ..$ parameter : num [1:2] -2.91e-07 5.08e-07 #>   ..$ seconds   : num 0.0131 #>   ..$ initial   : num [1:2] -1 1 #>   ..$ gradient  : num [1:2] -0.00824 0.0144 #>   ..$ code      : int 2 #>   ..$ iterations: int 33 #>  $ stats::optim       :List of 7 #>   ..$ value      : num 3.57 #>   ..$ parameter  : num [1:2] -0.969 0.969 #>   ..$ seconds    : num 0.000167 #>   ..$ initial    : num [1:2] -1 1 #>   ..$ counts     : Named int [1:2] 45 NA #>   .. ..- attr(*, "names")= chr [1:2] "function" "gradient" #>   ..$ convergence: int 0 #>   ..$ message    : NULL #>  $ pracma::nelder_mead:List of 7 #>   ..$ value      : num 0 #>   ..$ parameter  : num [1:2] 0 0 #>   ..$ seconds    : num 0.000552 #>   ..$ initial    : num [1:2] -1 1 #>   ..$ count      : num 111 #>   ..$ convergence: num 0 #>   ..$ info       :List of 2 #>   .. ..$ solver  : chr "Nelder-Mead" #>   .. ..$ restarts: num 0
